page.title: 01THE BIRSTALL D-BLOCK
page.content: The area which we surveyed is primarily rural with no industrial centres. It lies on the partly mixed and clay soil, forced up as a glacier moved along the course of the river Soar in the Ice Age. Essentially agricultural, it is dominated by the residential nature of Birstall which is mentioned in the{Domesday Book. The block stretches from the ruins of Birstall Lodge in the south to the Rothley Terminus of the Main LIne Steam Trust in the north and from Cropston Cemetery in the west to Wanlip Sewage Works in the east. The report covers the whole block but we have concentrated on the centre of population.{Unfortunately some of {the historically interesting features {fall outside the D-Block}i.e. Our Lady and St. Nicholas Church at Wanlip and Old Birstall.
